      • getClientCertSocketFactoryPEM

        public static SSLSocketFactory getClientCertSocketFactoryPEM​(String pemPath,
                                                             boolean verifyPeer)
                                                      throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                             FileNotFoundException,
                                                             IOException,
                                                             KeyStoreException,
                                                             CertificateException,
                                                             UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                                             KeyManagementException,
                                                             InvalidKeySpecException
        Obtain a SSLSocketFactory that provides a client certificate from a PEM file and optionally verifies the server's certificate.
        Parameters:
        pemPath - Path to the PEM file
        verifyPeer - true to use the default trust store to verify the server, false to accept the server's certificate regardless of attributes
        Returns:
        The SSLSocketFactory
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        FileNotFoundException - If the PEM file cannot be found
        IOException - If unable to read the PEM file
        KeyStoreException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        CertificateException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        UnrecoverableKeyException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        KeyManagementException - If unable to create the SocketFactory
        InvalidKeySpecException - If unable to create the SocketFactory

      • parseDERFromPEM

        public static byte[] parseDERFromPEM​(byte[] pem,
                                     String beginDelimiter,
                                     String endDelimiter)
        Parse PEM encoded bytes between type delimiters and return the DER encoded bytes. A PEM file may contain one or more of: a certificate, private key, public key, certificate signing request, certificate signing request response. The items in a PEM file each have a beginning and end delimiter. Example delimiters: -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- -----END CERTIFICATE----- PEM encoded bytes are base64 encoded. This method will convert the bytes back into non-base64 encoded binary. This method may need to be called more than once; each time with different delimiters, if the input bytes contain multiple items (i.e. both certificate and private key).
        Parameters:
        pem - The bytes to parse
        beginDelimiter - The begin delimiter
        endDelimiter - The end delimiter
        Returns:
        The DER encoded bytes

      • fetchCertificateFromPEM

        public static X509Certificate fetchCertificateFromPEM​(byte[] pem)
                                               throws CertificateException
        Get an X509Certificate from PEM bytes.
        Parameters:
        pem - The byte array
        Returns:
        The X509Certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateException - If unable to obtain the certificate

        Parameters:
        keyBytes - the bytes
        Returns:
        The RSAPrivateKey
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - If unable to create a key from the bytes
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If RSA is not supported in this JVM
